title: Umran, Raebareli
text:
Umran, also spelled Umaran, is a village in <a href="Rohaniya">Rohaniya</a> block of <a href="Rae%20Bareli%20district">Rae Bareli district</a>, <a href="Uttar%20Pradesh">Uttar Pradesh</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located 44km from <a href="Raebareli">Raebareli</a>, the district headquarters. As of 2011, it has a population of 4,786 people, in 918 households. It has one primary school and one primary health sub centre. It hosts a <a href="haat">haat</a> on Mondays and Fridays.
The <a href="1961%20Census%20of%20India">1961 census</a> recorded Umran as comprising 10 hamlets, with a total population of 1,665 people (838 male and 827 female), in 396 households and 394 physical houses. The area of the village was given as 1,609 <a href="acre">acre</a>s and it had electricity at that point.
The <a href="1981%20Census%20of%20India">1981 census</a> recorded Umran (as "Umaran") as having a population of 2,513 people, in 661 households, and having an area of 651.14 <a href="hectare">hectare</a>s. The main staple foods were listed as wheat and rice.
